definition.name: NXspm_positioner
definition.doc:
An extension of positioner, used to maintain a measurement signal through a feedback loop, specialized for scanning probe microscopy applications.
The component positions the spm head or cantilever tip on the surface of the sample thus maps 2D scan of the sample.

group.name: z_controller
group.doc:
This controller's task is to continuously adjust the Z position of tip (e.g., in topography scan in STM/STS experiment) in order to keep the selected control signal as close as possible to the Set Point. Different control signals lead to different controller's behavior.
The second PID feedback loop intends to position the tip in the Z direction.
p_gain (proportional gain) from z_controller refers to K_p value from PID controller. i_gain (integral gain) from z_controller refers to K_i value from PID controller. setpoint from z_controller refers to setpoint from PID controller.
Usually, the same controller, (z_controller) will be used for positioning the tip in three dimensional space. In this case, the controller coefficients (proportional, integral, differential) and other characteristic constants will be the same. Otherwise, for separate controllers positioning the tip in 3D space use the :ref:`feedback </NXspm_positioner/actuator/feedback-group>` controller in actuator.

field.name: D_t
field.doc: The derivative time constant of the derivative part of the PID controller. Proportional Derivative constant K_d can be expressed as :math:`K_d = K_p D_t`.

field.name: I_t
field.doc: The integral time constant of the integral part of the PID controller. Proportional Integral constant K_i can be expressed as :math:`K_i = \frac{K_p}{I_t}`.

field.name: z
field.doc: To indicate the relative tip position z between tip and sample. The tip position can also be varied when the z_controller is not running.

field.name: set_point
field.doc: The set point for the z-controller to be fixed and the target value could be height or current.

field.name: feedback_on
field.doc: The status of the controller PID feedback system in z-axis is ON / OFF. E.g., for constant height mode, the z-controller feedback system is off.

field.name: tip_lift
field.doc: If the tip is lifted from the stable point.

field.name: switch_off_delay
field.doc: The switch-off delay of the controller from its stable point.

field.name: z_offset_value
field.doc: Offset added to the initial averaged tip position on Z-axis before starting scan.

field.name: z_average_time
field.doc: The averaging time for stabilizing the Z position. Usually, the signal for z-position contains noise, to reduce the noise impacts, z-position is being averaged over this time window.

field.name: z_controller_time
field.doc: Time taken by the Z controller to switch mode e.g., feedback off from on and vice versa. In this time window, controller fixed its position if feedback changed to off mode.

field.name: z_controller_hold
field.doc: Controller feedback system status: OFF / ON. The `z_controller_hold-field` is True, refers feedback system off (mostly case in STS bias spectra) and False refers feedback system on (mostly case in STM constant current spectra).

field.name: final_z
field.doc: The final Z position of the tip after the scan. This parameter is used to indicate any unexpected displacement of the tip.

field.name: controller_label
field.doc: Controller label. This label which will be displayed at places where you can select a channel or controller.
